data.enText: -ies
power
the power to give orders to people
in a position of authority

data.chText: 她现在管辖着过去是她上司的那些人。
data.enText: She now has authority over the people who used to be her bosses.

data.chText: 什么也办不了，因为掌权的谁也不认真对待这个问题。
data.enText: Nothing will be done because no one in authority (= who has a position of power) takes the matter seriously.
the power or right to do sth

data.chText: 只有经理才有权签支票。
data.enText: Only the manager has the authority to sign cheques.
permission
official permission to do sth

data.chText: 做这件事未经校长批准。
data.enText: It was done without the principal's authority.

data.chText: 我们是经联合国授权行动的。
data.enText: We acted under the authority of the UN.
organization
the people or an organization who have the power to make decisions or who have a particular area of responsibility in a country or region

data.chText: 卫生当局正在调查这个问题。
data.enText: The health authorities are investigating the problem.
I have to report this to the authorities.
knowledge
the power to influence people because they respect your knowledge or official position

data.chText: 他就这个课题发表权威意见。
data.enText: He spoke with authority on the topic.
expert
a person with special knowledge
She's an authority on criminal law.
have sth on good authority
to be able to believe sth because you trust the person who gave you the information

ex.chText: 我们视他为美国文学方面的权威。
ex.enText: We see him as an authority on American literature.

ex.chText: 她是小麦病害方面的权威。
ex.enText: She is a leading authority on wheat diseases.

synonyms.bx: 指某学科或某方面的专家、大师，常后接介词 on。

ex.chText: 自动化科学家/化学家/物理学家

synonyms.bx: 指从事科学研究工作的科技人员或某一学科的专家。

ex.chText: 在她看来，经理在如何达到自己的目的方面很在行。
ex.enText: In her opinion, the manager is an expert at getting his own way.

synonyms.bx: 指通过培训或实践获得了有关某一方面的特殊技能或知识的人，常后接介词 on/at/in。

ex.chText: 詹姆斯博士是位信息检索专家。
ex.enText: Dr. James is a specialist/an expert in information retrieval.
He is a specialist/an expert in computer programming.

synonyms.bx: 指某一特定领域或研究中的专家，常可与 expert 换用，常后接介词 in。

data.enText: have sth on good authority
to be able to believe sth because you trust the person who gave you the information

example: authority for the program was renewed several times

tr: the power or right to give orders or make decisions
example: he has the authority to issue warrants
deputies are given authorization to make arrests
a place of potency in the state

tr: belief in yourself and your abilities
example: his assurance in his superiority did not make him popular
after that failure he lost his confidence
this book is the final authority on the life of Milton

tr: an expert whose views are taken as definitive
example: he is an authority on corporate law

tr: (usually plural) persons who exercise (administrative) control over others
example: the authorities have issued a curfew

value.def: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.

example.ex: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections...
example.tran: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

example.ex: The prison authorities have been criticised for not moving more quickly to end the protest by inmates.
example.tran: 监狱当局因没有尽快采取行动制止犯人抗议而受到批评。

value.def: An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.

example.ex: Any alterations had to meet the approval of the local planning authority.
example.tran: 任何改建都要取得当地规划机构的批准。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft in names

value.def: Authority is the right to command and control other people.

example.ex: Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas...
example.tran: 各地警察局局长应当重树其维护辖区安定的执法者形象。

example.ex: The judge had no authority to order a second trial.
example.tran: 法官无权进行二次审判。

value.def: If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.

example.ex: He had no natural authority and no capacity for imposing his will on others.
example.tran: 他天生缺乏威信，根本没有能力把他的意志强加于人。

value.def: Authority is official permission to do something.

example.ex: The prison governor has refused to let him go, saying he must first be given authority from his own superiors.
example.tran: 监狱长拒绝释放他，说他首先必须得到上级官员的许可。

value.def: Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.

example.ex: He's universally recognized as an authority on Russian affairs.
example.tran: 他是公认的俄罗斯事务专家。

value.def: If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.

example.ex: I have it on good authority that there's no way this light can cause skin cancer.
example.tran: 我有来自权威人士的说法，这种光不可能引起皮肤癌。
